title.narrative: COVID-19 SALAR 2018: Local governance and basic services in Syrias neighbouring countries
COVID-19 SKL 2018: Lokal samhällsstyrning och samhällstjänster i Syriens grannländer

description.narrative: Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19 Sida has received an application from the Swedish Association of Local Authorities and Regions (SALAR) for the project, Resilience in Local Governance (RESLOG): Lebanon and Turkey. The overall objective of the Project is sustainable and resilient local governance systems in Lebanon and Turkey, which are peaceful, inclusive, and provide equal and effective services to people. The application is based om the feasibility SALAR has conducted in Jordan, Lebanon, and Turkey in 2016-2017. After the feasibility study, Sida and SALAR agreed to commence an inception project in Turkey and Lebanon including the development of a full project proposal for Sida approval, establishment of project organisations, as well as implementation of selected activities. With the feasibilitystudie as a basis and the experiences of the inceptionphase Sida decides to support RESLOG during the period 1 December to 31 December 2020 with the amount of 71.500.000 SEK.

Omprogrammerade medel för att bekämpa covid-19 Sida har erhållit en ansökan om stöd till projektet Resilience in Local Governance (RESLOG) som ska implementeras i Libanon och Turkiet. Projektet syftar till mer hållbara och motståndskraftiga lokala samhällsstyrningssystem i dessa länder för att skapa fredliga och inkluderande strukturer och som på ett effektivt sätt och på mer jämlika villkor förser människor med samhällstjänster. Ansökan baseras på den förstudie som Sveriges kommuner och landsting (SKL) genomfört under 2016-2017 i Jordanien, Libanon och Turkiet. Med denna studie som underlag fattades under 2017 ett beslut att påbörja en inceptionsfas i Libanon och Turkiet och att utveckla ett fullständig projektansökan med förslag på aktiviteter, budget etc. Mot bakgrund av underlag i form av den feasibilitustudie som genomförts och erfarenheterna av inceptionsfasen beslutar Sida att stödja genomförande av RESLOG under perioden 1 december 2018 till 31 december 2020 med 71.500.000 MSEK.

The intervention aims at enhanced policy framework, improved dialogue, and strategic capacity for sustainable and resilient local governance in Turkey and in Lebanon in communities specially affected by the Syrian crisis. The project has a planned implementation period of 28 months – from September 2018 to end of December 2020 – as this is the endpoint for the Sweden’s Regional Strategy for the Syria Crisis strategy. It is especially in the first strategic activity area where RESLOG belongs. It reads: Strengthened resilience, human security and freedom from violence, with a focus on livelihood opportunities, increased access to public services and reduced gender-based violence. The global objective of the project is: Sustainable and resilient local governance systems in Lebanon and Turkey, which are peaceful, inclusive, and provide equal and effective services to peopleSpecific goal in Turkey Enhanced policy framework, improved dialogue, and strategic capacity for sustainable and resilient local governance in Turkey.Specific goal in Lebanon: Strengthened municipal governance, service provision, and area-based coordination in the Akkar governorate. Specific geographical focus areas: In Lebanon, RESLOG will be implemented in the Akkar governorate in the north of the country and in Turkey the project will work in two distinct geographical areas demarcated through the Regional Unions of Municipalities of Marmara and Çukurova – both with significant numbers of Syrians refugees.

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

title.narrative: SALAR 2018:Local governance & basic services in Syria- Decision on Contribution
SALAR 2018:Local governance & basic services in Syria- Grant Agreement

description.narrative: The activities of the project (implementation phase) just started at the beginning of 2019, as a continuity of the results achieved during the inception phase. The project establishment in Lebanon was more challenging than in Turkey, as the local context in Akkar is complex, especially considering the pressure for services due to the high numbers of immigrants/refugees. In addition to the fact that Lebanon is also a new country for SALAR operations. The activities in Turkey has advanced quicker due to the experience of SALAR in the country added to the well-organized municipal system of Turkey. This first period of activities is related with the establishment of offices, signing MoU with the federation of municipalities in the areas of intervention, capacity building workshops to majors and municipality officials, and coordination and networking with relevant stakeholders. In Lebanon solid waste management and public procurement are key subjects. In Turkey the key subject is related to digitalization of the information related to strategic planning for integration. Gender mainstreaming, capacity building, environmental awareness and conflict prevention are cross cutting objectives in both countries. There is no reporting agreed for this period (first reporting will be submitted in March 2020) and therefore no results are officially reported, but during the biannual meeting carried out on September 23 this year SALAR stated that the project is reaching results as planned. Highlighted results were capacity building related to public procurement and public private partnership building in Akkar, and strategic planning regarding integration on Marmara and Cukorova. SKL also underline advances in networking with relevant stakeholders in the areas of intervention as a relevant progress result of the project.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
